channel.title: Vps Server HELP!?!
channel.description:
ok well i installed java and all on my vps, and i get
'java' is not recognized as an internal or external command, operable program or batch file. Press any key to continue . . .
i set all the enviroment variables or what ever..

item.title: Vps Server HELP!?!
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

[quote=“epicboy123, post:27, topic:273726”][quote author=atrix676 link=topic=361723.msg2750222#msg2750222 date=1239857219]
shure
Ok follow this step
path should be like this

%SystemRoot%\system32;%SystemRoot%;%SystemRoot%\System32\Wbem

If you have classpath delete it as it is not needed on the vps
reply if u need more help[br][br][size=1]Posted on: April 15, 2009, 10:49:04 pm[/size][hr]send me your enviroment variables
[br][br][size=1]Posted on: April 15, 2009, 10:50:44 pm[/size][hr]all the enviroment variables you set delete them there not needed[br][br][size=1]Posted on: April 15, 2009, 10:51:16 pm[/size][hr]Try do the 3 methods if they dont work tell me
[/quote]atrix she doesnt need help anymore lol she doesnt have a vps but atm we are having a fight opening up the rdp… i trusted her to help me set up vps and she was desperate to help me so much turns out she hacked me… hang on ill try find the post wheree i said i needed help and she said ill help…[/quote]
DUDE EVER HEARD of opening a vpsland support ticket
or go to https://VPSSERVERIP:4643/vz/cp
cahge the vpssevrerip with your vps ip log on as adminstatior and your vps password change the password and kick her out easy as Pie lol?

Read full topic

item.title: Vps Server HELP!?!
item.dc:creator: @Barrage1 Denoria
item.description:
@Barrage1 wrote:

[quote=“Newty, post:10, topic:273726”]Go into this folder:

C:\Program Files(x86)\Java\jdk1.5.0_18\bin\

and look for a file called Java.exe, tell me if its in there.[/quote]Yes there is

Read full topic

item.title: Vps Server HELP!?!
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

C:\Program Files(x86)\Java\jdk1.5.0_18\bin\

and look for a file called Java.exe, tell me if its in there.

Read full topic

item.title: Vps Server HELP!?!
item.dc:creator: @Barrage1 Denoria
item.description:
@Barrage1 wrote:

[quote=“Newty, post:8, topic:273726”]Try changing it to:

@echo off
COLOR F4
title Run
"C:\Program Files(x86)\Java\jdk1.5.0_18\bin\JAVA.exe"  -Xmx1024m server

Probably wont help, but worth a shot.[/quote]ffs…same error, why?

Read full topic

item.title: Vps Server HELP!?!
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

Try changing it to:

@echo off
COLOR F4
title Run
"C:\Program Files(x86)\Java\jdk1.5.0_18\bin\JAVA.exe"  -Xmx1024m server

Probably wont help, but worth a shot.

Read full topic
